channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-12916] No access control for replicating WAL entries
item.description:
Currently, there is no access control for replicating WAL entries in secure HBase cluster. Any authenticated user can write any data they want to any table of a secure cluster by using the replication api.

Simple solution is to add permission check before replicating WAL entries. And only user with global write permission can replicate WAL entries to this cluster.

Another option is adding "Replication" action in hbase and only user with "Replication" permission can replicate WAL entries to this cluster?

Andrew Purtell

What's your suggestion? Thanks
item.summary: No access control for replicating WAL entries

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Add permission check before replicating WAL entries in AccessController, and only user with global write permission can replicate WAL entries to this cluster.

This message is automatically generated.

RSO seems like a good place to hang a new hook.

The style of pre- CP hooks is to give the observer access to available information to make an informed authoritative decision. So RegionServerObserver#preReplicateLogEntries should accept the same arguments as ReplicationSinkService#replicateLogEntries, like:


+  void preReplicateLogEntries(final ObserverContext<RegionServerCoprocessorEnvironment> ctx,

+      List<WALEntry> entries, CellScanner cells) throws IOException;

Update for Andrew Purtell's review.
Thanks

nit: In AccessController, is the following code block necessary?


+  @Override

+  public void postReplicateLogEntries(ObserverContext<RegionServerCoprocessorEnvironment> ctx,

+      List<WALEntry> entries, CellScanner cells) throws IOException {

+  }

Also, is the post hook call in testReplicateLogEntries() really needed?

Srikanth Srungarapu
AccessController extends BaseMasterAndRegionObserver and has to implement the interface of RegionServerObserver, so we need empty function of postReplicateLogEntries at least.
Overlooked the extends and implements clauses. Sorry for the noise.
